name: [we sell boxes]
title: Enthusiastically pessimistic, and sometimes angry, electronic music.
description: [we sell boxes] is the moniker of a production outfit primarily concerned with techno, house, IDM, electro and others forms of electronic music, dance or otherwise.

singles.title: Twinks on K
singles.description: Not that long ago I was listening to an old Villalobos LP that got me thinking about the whole mid 00’s minimal thing – DC10, Poker Flat, Love Dose etc – and decided to have a go at a similar type of track myself. Not sure how minimal this actually is but production is all about the tangents anyway.

singles.title: Géant's Garden
singles.description: A track that was originally written as part of a live set to play at a friend’s barbecue. Their name isn’t Géant though. He’s a cat that keeps getting shit from other cats in the locale (and an arsehole neighbour), despite the fact that it’s his garden and they’re all coming to it to give him grief. Calling upon the inclusive, healing power of house to send its vibes and chill the situation out for all - especially for Géant.

singles.title: Flat On My Back
singles.description: Flat On My Back was written after one full year without any paid work. Despite applying for hundreds of jobs, networking, trying to remain positive, doing free courses online and undertaking all the other advice bestowed to anyone in the same position, it’s been a mental struggle to fight acrimony, remain focused and still be an asset to any future employer. This track, and the subsequent video, attempts to encapsulate the constant despondency, rejection, disillusionment, alienation and the perpetual worry that comes with being long term unemployed, while at the same time it’s creation provided some element of personal catharsis along the way.

singles.title: Carpetbaggers
singles.description: Carpetbaggers laments the bigots, racists, trollomists and truthers that occupy an ever increasing yet spirit crushing facet of the internet. Monkeys in an enclosure continually throwing shit at the glass to provoke a reaction, any reaction, to placate their egos and increase both their social and fiscal net worth. Which is the truly disheartening factor to it all. Do they actually believe or believe in the bile they spew or is it all just easy money at the expense of their own self-respect? Most of us can and do refuse to play but that doesn’t absolve the real life harm and the accountability of the carpetbagger.

singles.title: Foolish Proles Make It Easy
singles.description: You are being told who to hate, who to fear and who to blame.

singles.title: Mllody
singles.description: The idea that you can become something in this world and really make a difference is an illusion. Anyone who to seeks to make a real change in this world, to go out and do something, is eventually going to come up to the realization that the underpinnings of this world are so corrupt, that you really cannot succeed. Unless you are willing to compromise what you know in your heart, isn't really right.

singles.title: Divisive Strategies
singles.description: A wedge issue is a social issue which splits apart a population or political group. Wedge issues are an attempt to weaken the unity of a population, with the goal of enticing polarized individuals to give support to an opponent or to withdraw their support entirely out of disillusionment.

singles.title: Helpless
singles.description: They have their conferences, sign their CITES agreements and retire to the business lounges. They release their press packs and logos go on websites, proud to be supporting whatever initiative. Self-perpetuating, achieving nothing.

singles.title: BBD SC
singles.description: A remix for a folk/blues live act done a few years ago. The final mix probably needs revisiting nowadays but it's not without it's charm and was a lot of fun to do at the time.

lps.title: [we sell boxes] The Game's A Bogey

sessions.title: Live Techno Session – June 2016
sessions.description: A techno jam recorded live one afternoon in June 2016. The Roland TR-8 is obviously providing the drums, while the Elektron Analog Four supplies the bass, lead, drone and the rasping stab that comes in for the final third part. The Korg Volca Sample provides the one shots and vocal samples that are triggered manually. There’s an excellent trick to get more sample time, for less memory, out of the Volca Sample. Pitch the original samples up 12, 24 or 36 semitones in an audio editor before exporting and then restore back to the original pitch in the Volca by using the Speed knob. The RE-20 Space Echo is used extensively and there’s a touch of TC Electronic’s Hall Of Fame Reverb over most channels.
